Q: If Huawei loses the war on 5G outside of China, does it mean China's march towards 5G or even 6G global leadership is dashed? A: Yes. in fact Huawei/China already lost. No one is paying patent royalties to Huawei because Huawei did not invent 5G5G was invented by The West (as was all other cell technologies)The 3GPP is the International standards body that governs 3G, 4G (LTE) 5G, etc., Huawei/China must abide by those rules3GPP - Wikipedia5G manufacturers all file for patents on their specific hardware to try and prevent others from copying their exact cell tower hardwareIn the first quarter of 2019 when Huawei was boasting that they owned all the critical patents to 5G, and the Chinese government made it appear that everyone would have to pay Huawei for their 5G patents, the truth is that Nokia (not even counting Ericsson) already had 50% more 5G patents than Huawei had, and Nokia/Ericsson were filing 5G patents at a rate far faster than Huawei, so they completely overwhelmed Huawei with 5G patentsIn truth no one will pay Huawei for anything because Huawei did not invent anything, it simply has its own implementation of 5G, just like everyone else has its own implementation of 5GHuawei attempted to lead the industry by using Chinese taxpayer subsidies to rush their 5G to market to tray and get The West to buy their early, discounted, 5G hardware but that plan failed.This put Huawei one year of every else in starting their bulk of designing production line startup, but despite the long head start from the taxpayer subsidies, Huawei is now far behind Nokia and Ericsson in 5GNot only is Huawei behind in 5G (in the real world), there is no such thing as 6G since the 3GPP has not finished standardizing 5G yet, so there are no 6G standards so in act no one can work on something that does not existThe West is not buying any Huawei 5G hardwareThe West is actually buying their 5G cell tower hardware from Nokia and EricssonIn fact, the UK has issued orders to remove all existing Huawei networking hardware from their networks by 2025, so Huawei actually will have a negative market shareBy the end of summer 2020, the three cell phone carriers in the United States have already deployed 5G coverage from coast to coast (using Nokia and Ericsson cell tower hardware), at the same time Huawei only has placed coverage inside 3 cities in China (the Chinese government is falsely reporting wider coverage by quoting full city coverage when in fact they only installed a few towers in rural areas outside a few other cities) either way, China doe snot have full coverage, so they are well behind the USSo no matter how you look at it, Huawei and China are far behind the United States and The WestHuawei will most likely only sell 5G hardware into China and into a few places in Africa where the Chinese government is pouring massive subsidies int so Huawei will not have any significant impact on the 5G cell tower business.
